introduction: Report any threats to national security - such as terrorism and espionage - to MI5 (also known as the Security Service).
more_information:
%Call 999 or the police anti-terrorist hotline on 0800 789 321 to report an immediate threat.%

##Confidentiality
Your message will be sent over a secure internet connection. You can choose to remain anonymous or include your contact details so the Security Service can get in touch with you.

All the information you send will be treated confidentially. 

##Other ways to contact MI5
You can report threats by phone or in writing.

$C
**MI5 terrorism hotline**  
0800 111 4645 (freephone, except on mobiles)  
020 7930 9000 (charged at your telephone provider's normal rates)
$C

$A 
The Enquiries Desk  
PO Box 3255  
London  
SW1P 1AE  
$A
overview: Report any threats to national security - such as terrorism and espionage - to MI5 (also known as the Security Service)
title: Report suspicious activity to MI5
